tp.pr5.controller

Class ConsoleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr5.controller.Controller
      • tp.pr5.controller.ConsoleController

  • public class ConsoleController
extends Controller
    The controller employed when the application is configured as a console application.
    It contains the simulation loop that executes the instructions written by the user on the console.
    It handles and process the input from the keyboard by the user.
    This class is only visible to package level.
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste

      void finalize()

      void startController()
      Associate the model to the controller (RobotEngine), register observers, make configurations and startup the game.
      It must be Override depends on the type of interface chosen by the user.
      It's absolutely essential that this method call to engine.requestStart()

    • Method Detail

      • startController

        public void startController()
        Description copied from class: Controller
        Associate the model to the controller (RobotEngine), register observers, make configurations and startup the game.
        It must be Override depends on the type of interface chosen by the user.
        It's absolutely essential that this method call to engine.requestStart()
        Specified by:
        startController in class Controller

      • userInterfacePrompt

        private java.lang.String userInterfacePrompt()
        Method for console prompt. It shows the head of each command (WALL·E) and read the user input
        Returns:
        The input introduced by the user via keyboard.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Close the input reader before finalize this object
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Actually nothing. The only possibility exception raised by this method it's from super implementation of finalize(), i.e. Object.
